author: Suresh Krishnamoorthy
text:
Expressing solidarity with the students of University of Hyderabad (UoH), the New Delhi-based National Confederation of Human Rights Organisations has demanded that amendments be made to the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities Act) and punitive action taken against discrimination and other forms of harassments to students.

At a press conference here on Friday, the National Chairperson of the Confederation Prof. A. Marx said Rohith Vemula’s death was not just a mere suicide of a Dalit scholar, but described it an institutional killing.

A team spent time on the campus meeting several faculty members, research scholars and agitating students.
title: Human rights body backs students
